channel.title: Community Television Network on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Community Television Network on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Answers from CTN regarding City of Ann Arbor closed captioning
item.description: Answers to questions sent to Greg McDonald, CTN manager, regarding closed captioning at on City of Ann Arbor's Community Television Network. Why are you providing closed captioning? The Commission on Disability Issues made a request to add captions to their meetings to increase meeting accessibility. Who is providing the closed captioning for CTN? ScreenLine, L.L.C. How much is the size of the contract, and for how long does it run?

item.title: Watching a public meeting with five windows open to the world -
item.description: The Ann Arbor City Council holds meetings twice each month, which are streamed online through the city's CTN network. I tuned in last night on my laptop to listen and watch. While I was listening, I had a few other windows open on my computer. First and foremost, I had a twitter stream that I was watching for the #a2council hash tag; that caught commentary from a few other people who were watching at home, plus some reporters in the audience.

item.title: Ann Arbor City Council meetings now simulcast online
item.description: Ann Arbor City Council meetings are now simulcast online, which is handy if you don't get local CTN cable service.  This link http://a2docs.org/assets/files/2011/03/21/a2govtvcrawl.html goes to an experimental setup which also tracks the Twitter #aacitycouncil tag. The CTN Meetingplace page now hosts the current broadcast (both live and delayed) for CTN Channel 16. Meetings are held the first and third Monday nights of the month starting at 7:00 p.m., unless they aren't for some reason like a holiday.

item.title: What to watch on CTN, April 1-7, 2011
item.description:
What to watch on CTN is the City of Ann Arbor's weekly programming guide to public access cable. Download this week's flyer as a PDF. Here's show listings for April 1-7, 2011. Note that several of these are also available on demand over the Internet at http://a2gov.org/ctn .
Edward Vielmetti is certain to make it big in television if he ever gets a chance to break in to the big time.
